did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.repository: Special Collections, University of Virginia Library
did.abstract: The collection contains a slave bill of sale from 1816 December 26 for a girl named Harriet, and a letter, 1861 Deptember 20, on behalf of Capt. J.W. Taylor, requesting advice on a slave who has made threats.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: There are two items, 1816 and 1861, regarding slavery in Virginia. Included are: an original slave bill of sale, December 26, 1815, from Andrew Squair of Albemarle County, for "one negro girl named Harriet," to Agnes Katharine Hamner; and, a letter, September 20, 1861, from C. J. Phillips, Walnut Grove, to John Collins, on behalf of Capt. J. W. Taylor, requesting him to ride down to Ashland to meet with them in order for them to seek his advice on a case involving a Negro who "has been making some very severe threats against me" [Phillips].
